intro: Domeykoa andina, commonly known as the Andean domeykoa, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs. Domeykoa andina is adapted to cold, mountainous environments and is often found in rocky soils at elevations above 3,000 meters.
